In the class taught in English our professional Chef will explain the dishes you will prepare. The classes are designed for experienced and novice cooks. Apron and recipes are provided. strIntroduction: Indulge in a well-deserved retreat with our Food and Wine Escapade in Barcelona Barcelona has it all: history, design, shopping, Mediterranean charm… and delicious food! Simply exploring the historic centre of Barcelona is a true pleasure, with main sights at walking distance from your charming hotel, including the beautiful Gothic quarter and the Cathedral, the lively Rambla and Gaudi’s fascinating buildings. Enjoy a delicious dinner at a Michelin-starred restaurant, and spend time with our personable local chef, who will guide you through a private visit to the colorful Boqueria food market.

For centuries, Spanish conquistadors set off on their voyages of discovery from Seville, Europe’s foremost gateway to the New World. Now you can discover the old world charm of the capital of Andalusia, an elegant and cosmopolitan city that will keep you enthralled and your photo album full.
There's no better way to see the sights and learn the history of Barcelona than by joining a bike tour!

Savor the artistic and historical richness of Salamanca and Portugal. Be enthralled by its emblematic architectural jewels and traditions with an unforgettable 5-day tour from Madrid. A unique experience discovering the charm of these fascinating destinations in all its grandeur!

The fastest way to see Ibiza is with our thrilling and action-packed speedboat adventure, which zooms along either the north or south coast, exploring beaches, coves, caves, reefs and much, much more. Join us for this exciting two-hour jaunt and discover parts of the island that few visitors ever have the chance to see.
Cooltra is the leading scooter rental company in Spain. Take advantage of the freedom a scooter gives you and discover places a conventional tourist will miss.

Explore the capital of Mallorca at your own pace with a 7-day Las Palmas Card and get free admission to more than 20 attractions, along with discounts on shopping, at restaurants and selected bars. Discover the home of Christopher Columbus, and more.

Learn how to cook an authentic Valencian paella in the home of the traditional Spanish paella. Visit the Valencia Central Market to learn about the ingredients necessary to make a traditional paella and then participate in a small group paella making competition before having the chance to try your own creation, as well as other authentic tapas.

Just two nautical miles south of Ibiza is the stunning and virtually unspoiled island of Formentera, one of the few remaining secrets of not just the Balearics but the whole of Europe. A visit to this idyllic hideaway is the icing on the cake of any Ibiza holiday.
strTitle: Formentera ferry ticket from San Antonio

strIntroduction: This amusement park has been wowing locals and visitors alike since the Swinging Sixties.

Located in the historical section of Ronda town, in a palace-like house with more than a thousand years of history. The old wine cellar has been transformed into a marvellous museum featuring twelve thematic rooms. Each invites the visitor to discover through the history and culture of wine, a product strongly present in Spanish society and associated to mythology and religion, and whose elaboration is a process of traditional work both in the countryside and in the wine cellar.

Choose among imaginative routes, on board a state-of-the-art machine and get to know Madrid the way it deserves to be visited.

Fashionistas, bargain hunters and shopaholics can indulge in some retail therapy in the renowned Las Rozas Village, a chic outlet shopping experience without equal. The mall is about 30 minutes away from the capital and there are three departures daily from central Madrid.
Villa Rosa Madrid offers the widest and most dynamic show schedule with the best flamenco singers, dancers and guitar players. Taste it along with a delicious Spanish dinner for a full-on experience.

Sample traditional Dutch food and drink on a food tour of picturesque Amsterdam. Try salty edam and smoky gouda cheeses, learn about the city’s spice trade at a spice house, and visit a 17th-century distillery to sip on some hard liquor.

Discover Bruges – one of the most captivating cities in Belgium – on this day trip from Amsterdam. After traveling to Bruges by coach, you will receive a brief overview of city sights from your knowledgeable guide. Then, enjoy 5 full hours exploring the churches, canals and lace shops of Bruges on your own. See the Begijnhof, the city gates and the eye-catching windmills. And indulge in some delicious Belgian chocolates on your ride back to Amsterdam!
Experience that ultimate Amsterdam night out that you have been waiting all your life.
Explore Amsterdam the ‘Dutch way’ – by bike! Following an expert local guide, enjoy a leisurely 3-hour bike ride around Amsterdam’s typically flat and open city streets – perfect for cycling!

Getting around Amsterdam is a breeze with a hop-on hop-off Canal Bus Day Pass. The boats operate a regular service along Amsterdam's canals, following four routes: the Green Line, Red Line, Blue Line and Orange Line. While you cruise, an on-board commentary provides interesting information about Amsterdam.

Explore Amsterdam’s Red Light District at night, when it truly comes alive. Your resident guide will show you the secret areas, and the back alleys of De Wallen. Visit coffee shops, meet local workers, and finish off at Cafe Remember with shots.
strTitle: Amsterdam Red Light District Walking Tour

Sit back and relax on a 2-hour candlelight cruise along Amsterdam's famous canals, the perfect way to unwind from a day of sightseeing or set the mood for a romantic night. This is an unforgettable way to experience Amsterdam's UNESCO World Heritage-listed canals!

Both tickets are open so you can use them independently whenever you wish, enabling you to make the most out of your stay in Amsterdam.

strIntroduction: Glide over the fairy chimneys and rock-cut houses of Cappadocia on a 1-hour hot air balloon flight, and get privileged views of the unique landscape from the air. Watch the sun rise over the valleys, and enjoy a Champagne toast upon your safe landing.
Enjoy a full day guided tour in Pamukkale National Park, one of the most interesting places in the world and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

This 3-hour culinary adventure takes you on a search for the hidden gems of Istanbul’s thriving street food scene. Sample a variety of tasty treats as your guide leads you to the city’s culinary heart, and finish off your tour in the Taksim Square area.
strTitle: Istanbul Night Tasting Trail : Eat and Drink Like a Local

strIntroduction: It’s where East meets West, and a city whose architecture and culture is as diverse as its history. Come and discover Istanbul, its sights and sounds with this combined tour by land and water.

Travel by boat from Istanbul to Büyükada and explore the largest of the Princes islands by horse-drawn carriage. See Ottoman-era mansions, enjoy a tasty lunch at a seafood restaurant, and afterwards take some time at your leisure to explore the island.

Discover the magic of the exotic Orient in this experience straight out of the Arabian Nights including a four course dinner, wine and soft drinks and a spectacular floor show featuring exotic Turkish belly dancers and a traditional Anatolian folklore ensemble.

strIntroduction: Visit the ancient city of Troy, immortalized by Homer in his epic the “Iliad.” Travel from Istanbul on this full-day tour, learn about the Trojan War, and gain an understanding of this importance of this site. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are included.

Listed by the Observer newspaper in London among The Best 100 Restaurants, Develi has a well-deserved reputation for consistently delivering the finest in Turkish cuisine.
